metadata.name: Journey of a Thousand Miles
metadata.description:
mountains high; kissing clouds 
roads long; twisting routes 
doubts about the journey mount, 
before the thought’s even out 

the mirror scolds of dreams untold  
let them go, it softly whispers 
wisps of wishes float down gently 
the air, heavy; thick – 
though not enough to hold dreams up 

they sink down, seeping 
a mind reaching, almost grieving 
deferred dreams of withered grapes 
knees clean; never scraped 

narratives that help escape,  
keep the mind, blindly caged 
the stage is set… 
to be content 

for what is a life well lived? 
if not to a heart, for which we give 

the question is, but of direction 
point the way, to take your steps in 

for these steps ARE the journey 
take them slow, without hurry 
it’s okay to worry and catch some bruises 
losing offers the way forward 

lessons earned with each shortcoming 
but take these steps, they keep on coming 
no need for running - just step, 
by step 
by step 
the path is kept, within sight 

slight turns and deviations 
broken mind of concentration 
but in the fog, keep on walking 
your heart is talking - keep on listening 

one step 
one breath 
beginnings of this lifelong quest 
ends are starts, where we depart 

the journey is but of the art 
so keep on walking, every day 
as steps convey, the inner self 

paint your path, 
and create 
your life
